msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Modifying flash component kit.  We now implement ILayoutElement directly on UIMovieClip.  I also fixed some scaling issues and worked on the Flash Container so we size children appropriately, adding a flag to size the content to the size of the flash container and a flag to unscale the flex content (even though it's parent is scaled due to resizing).

Because of this, we can remove ILayoutElementUIC.  Some point soon, we'll remove LayoutElementFactory and just assume all elements implement ILayoutElement (will do this change when we make IVisualElement extend ILayoutElement).
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

UIMovieClip needs to implement IVisualElement.  These are mostly some old changes I tried to make earlier before I understood the complexities of the different sizing models in UIMC vs UIC.  However, the important thing here really isn’t that the implementation for IVisualElement on UIMC be correct—it’s that it now compiles and we can continue to support UIMC in Gumbo.  Later, I’ll be taking a look at the different sizing models, and how we should correctly deal with transformations.
As part of this change, utilities.swc will use the files located in the flash-integration project rather than a pre-compiled SWC that was checked in.
This change will allow us to strongly type addElement, getElementAt, etc... to only work on IVisualElements.  That change will be coming a little later.

The beginning of the open-source Flex SDK.
Populated the flex/sdk/trunk directory with an open-source subset of files from //depot/flex/sdk/...@191097 in the Faramir Perforce server. This changelist is a bit past the 3.0rc0 build.
The Ant scripts will not successfully build yet. They need to be adapted to the open-source subset.

Remove ADOBE SYSTEMS license and replace with Apache license in headers - frameworks.  A 2nd pass will be needed to get the files not handled up by the scripts.
